details.title: Prime Minister Modi to address nation shortly
details.content: Happy Independence day. The country is celebrating it's 72nd Independence day today. (August 15).

Delhi: Visuals from the Red Fort. Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the nation shortly. pic.twitter.com/xyaRt1FUs8

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: PM Modi tweets Independence day greetings
details.content:
Independence Day greetings to the people of India. Jai Hind! #IndependenceDayIndia

स्वतंत्रता दिवस के शुभ अवसर पर सभी देशवासियों को शुभकामनाएं! जय हिंद!

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) August 15, 2018

Former Prime Ministers Manmohan Singh & HD Deve Gowda, Union Minister JP Nadda & BJP leader LK Advani at the Red Fort. #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/HRYgZlEkNJ

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018
According to media reports, the PM would be speaking on topics of education, cases of rape, employment, reservation system and open defecation.

Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/Yko8pgJlUX

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: PM arrives at Red Fort
details.content: PM Modi is received by Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Minister of State (MoS) for defence Dr Subhash Bhamre and Defence Secretary Sanjay Mitra.

Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrives at Red Fort, to address the nation shortly. #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/gPvCAgNb7o

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

Congress President Rahul Gandhi, Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari at #RedFort in Delhi. #IndiaIndependenceDay pic.twitter.com/AKdUgwPEm2

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: PM Modi hoists the national flag
details.content: The PM hoisted the tricolour on the ramparts of the Red Fort, followed by the national anthem. This will be Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s fifth and final address of his current tenure.

PM Narendra Modi unfurls the tricolour at Red Fort. #IndiaIndependenceDay pic.twitter.com/sTogztX64z

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: PM begins Independence Day speech
details.content: Narendra Modi begins address from the Red Fort.

details.title: Daughters making India proud
details.content: Indian Navy all-women crew of INS Tarini was hailed for their heroics by the PM.
Modi extends solidarity to citizens affected by monsoon-floods in different parts of the county.

details.title: OBC Commission strengthened
details.content: The recently concluded monsoon session of Parliament was one devoted to social justice. The Parliament session witnessed the passage of the bill to create an OBC Commission, he said.
The Prime Minister pays homage to Dr BR Ambedkar for giving the country a strong Constitution.

Next year on Baisakhi, it will be 100 years of Jallianwala Bagh massacre. I pay tribute to those who sacrificed their lives: PM Narendra Modi #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/u2ud1N8k6y

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: Rapid development in last four years
details.content: Taking a dig the UPA government, PM said it would have taken his government a hundred years at least if it was proceeding developmental works at the pace of its predecessor.

We are proud of what we have achieved and at the same time, we also have to look at where we have come from. That is when we will realised the remarkable strides the nation has made: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) August 15, 2018

We are very proud of what we have achieved but at the same time, we also have to look at where we have come from. That is when we will realize the unbelievable strides the nation has taken, the PM said.

The demand for higher MSP was pending for years. From farmers to political parties to agriculture experts, everybody was asking about it but nothing happened. With blessings of the farmers, the decision on MSP was taken by our Government: PM Modi #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/r8a4jMYk1E

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018
The country has become destination for trillion-dollar investment.

details.title: No more policy paralysis in India
details.content: India will lead, provide direction and speed to the global economy soon.

India's voice is being heard effectively at the world stage. We are integral parts of forums whose doors were earlier closed for us: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) August 15, 2018

details.title: PM calls India the land of reforms
details.content:
From being seen as among the fragile five, India is now the land of reform, perform and transform. We are poised for record economic growth: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) August 15, 2018
India's voice is now heard effectively at the global stage, said the PM.

details.title: Distance between North East states and national capital reduced
details.content: There was a time when North East India used to feel that Delhi is very far from them, but today we have brought Delhi to the doorstep of the North East, he said.

details.title: Scientists of the country hailed
details.content:
India is proud of our scientists, who are excelling in their research and are at the forefront of innovation: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) August 15, 2018

details.title: Manned spacecraft by 2022
details.content: "India will be the fourth country to send humans into space."

details.title: Indian farm production commendable
details.content: Hinting at the improving farming sector across the country, the PM said the production of honey has doubled and the production of sugar has tripled in the country. "We are the second highest in fish production and will soon become number one," he added.

As significant as economic growth, is dignity of the individual. Our schemes such as Ujjwala and Saubhagya Yojana are enhancing the dignity of fellow Indians: PM Modi #IndependenceDayIndia pic.twitter.com/0YkO81IftE

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

details.title: Swachh Bharat mission praised by WHO
details.content: Due to Swachh Bharat mission, lakhs of children can lead healthier lives. Even the WHO has praised it. Mahatma Gandhi led the Satyagrahis to freedom. Today, the Swachhagrahis have to ensure a Swachh Bharat, he said.

details.title: Healthcare scheme announced
details.content: "Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Abhiyaan will be launched on 25th September this year in order to ensure that the poor of India get access to good quality and affordable healthcare."
Ayushman Bharat National Health Protection Scheme aims to cover around 50 crore people. It will be rolled out on September 25 - the birth anniversary of Deen Dayal Upadhyay.

details.title: Tax payers' contributions crucial
details.content:
The honest taxpayer of India has a major role in the progress of the nation. It is due to them that so many people are fed, the lives of the poor are transformed: PM @narendramodi

— PMO India (@PMOIndia) August 15, 2018

details.title: Black money holders will not be spared
details.content: We will not spare the corrupt and those who stashed black money. They have ruined the country. Delhi's streets are now free from power brokers. From the voice of power brokers, the voice of the poor is heard, he said.

We have to free our society and country from this disgusting mentality of rape. Recently in Madhya Pradesh a rapist was hanged by fast track court. We should spread this news and make people aware. Rule of law is supreme,no one can take law in their hands: PM Modi pic.twitter.com/9ZKgR5DXcv

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018
Women officers commissioned in short service will get opportunity for permanent commission like their male counterparts: PM Modi

details.title: The practice of Triple Talaq has caused great injustice to Muslim women
details.content: We are striving to end this practice but there are some people who are not wanting it to end. I promise the Muslim women that I will work to ensure justice is done to them: PM Modi

I am proud of the fact that three women judges in Supreme Court are delivering justice. Since independence, this is the first cabinet where so many women are a part of the cabinet: PM Modi #IndiaIndependenceDay pic.twitter.com/tWuFh0CFxk

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018

Hum goli aur gaali ke raaste par nahi par gale laga ke aage badhna chahte hain. Aane wale kuch hi mahino mein Kashmir mein gaon ke logon ko apna haq jatane ka avsar milega aur panchayat chunav honge: PM Modi

Tripura, Meghalaya and many parts of Arunachal Pradesh are seeing historic peace. From 126, Left Wing Extremism is restricted to 90 districts. We are working to ensure peace across the nation: PM Modi pic.twitter.com/wSEkwgp4yu

— ANI (@ANI) August 15, 2018
After concluding his address PM Modi shook hands with the children present at the function in the Indian tricolour.
